meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Get ready for a linguistic adventure that will have you chanting with joy!

As I dived into the world of Chants of Sennaar, I couldn't help but think of all the critics who came before me. I mean, who are they to tell us what's good and what's not? I'm just a humble reviewer trying to bring some much-needed humor to this industry.

But enough about them (more on that later). Chants of Sennaar is a puzzle game like no other - it's all about translation, baby! You play as an archaeologist tasked with uncovering the secrets of ancient languages. Sounds simple, right? Wrong!

The puzzles are intricate, and the linguistic challenges will have you scratching your head (or in my case, pulling out what little hair I have left). But that's what makes this game so unique. It's like solving a puzzle, learning a new language, and playing a stealth game all at once! Talk about a brain workout!

Now, let me get back to those critics. I mean, Slant Magazine called it an "academic" experience... yawn! Worth Playing said it's "fascinating"... duh! And SpazioGames just gave it a generic thumbs-up. But then there are the ones who truly get it - God is a Geek said it makes you feel like a genius (I mean, who doesn't want that?), and Noisy Pixel called it a universal experience.

As for me? I'm just here to tell you that Chants of Sennaar is an absolute blast! It's the perfect blend of brains and brawn - or rather, linguistics and stealth. Trust me when I say you won't find this level of linguistic adventure anywhere else. So grab your headphones, put on your thinking caps, and get ready to chant like nobody's business!

What do you think, readers? Are you up for a puzzle-adventure that will challenge even the most seasoned gamers? Let me know in the comments!
